page.title: 02HOME LIFE IN BRANSTON
page.content: A typical day in our house starts at half past seven when I get up. I have my breakfast at eight o'-clock. I have cornflakes. Everyone is dressed and washed and on their way to school or work by a quarter to nine. My sister and I go to school and my mum goes to work at Newark to work in the Social Services. My dad is a car body worker at Washingborough. When I get home at half past three I watch TV. It is on all evening until my mum and dad have gone to bed. At about half past seven the family has tea. We usually have pork chops, beans, cabbage and gravy.Then we watch TV until bedtime. I go to bed between ten and half past. .
